com.shelbot.utils

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shelbot.utils.Button
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageButton

    public class Button
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a Button. It can be used to switch between different tabs and is drawn using Processing PApplet.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.awt.Color highlightColor 
      protected boolean isHighlight 
      boolean overButton 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Button() 
      Button(int x, int y, float width, float height, java.lang.String text)
      Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, and not having an icon or color
      Button(int x, int y, float width, float height, java.lang.String text, boolean hasIcon, java.awt.Color color)
      Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, the color of the button, and whether or not the button has an icon
      Button(int x, int y, float width, float height, java.lang.String text, java.awt.Color textColor, int textSize)
      Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, the color of the button, and whether or not the button has an icon

      • Button

        public Button()

      • Button

        public Button(int x,
              int y,
              float width,
              float height,
              java.lang.String text)
        Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, and not having an icon or color
        Parameters:
        x - main x-coordinate of the button
        y - main y-coordinate of the button
        width - the width of the button
        height - the height/length of the button
        text - states what the button represents

      • Button

        public Button(int x,
              int y,
              float width,
              float height,
              java.lang.String text,
              boolean hasIcon,
              java.awt.Color color)
        Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, the color of the button, and whether or not the button has an icon
        Parameters:
        x - main x-coordinate of the button
        y - main y-coordinate of the button
        width - the width of the button
        height - the height/length of the button
        text - states what the button represents
        hasIcon - states whether or not the button is represented by an icon or not
        color - the color the button will be filled with

      • Button

        public Button(int x,
              int y,
              float width,
              float height,
              java.lang.String text,
              java.awt.Color textColor,
              int textSize)
        Creates a new instance of a Button object with a starting x and y coordinate, a button width and height, the text representing the button, the color of the button, and whether or not the button has an icon
        Parameters:
        x - main x-coordinate of the button
        y - main y-coordinate of the button
        width - the width of the button
        height - the height/length of the button
        text - states what the button represents
        textColor - the color of the text
        textSize - the size of the text

      • draw

        Draws a new instance of a Button object
        Parameters:

      • highlight

        public void highlight(boolean isHighlight)
        Changes the color of the button in order to show that it has been highlighted
        Parameters:
        isHighlight - states whether or not the button is highlighted

      • overButton

        public boolean overButton(int mouseX,
                          int mouseY)
        Determines if the point (x,y) is contained inside a Button object
        Parameters:
        mouseX - the x-coordinate tested for being over the button
        mouseY - the y-coordinate tested for being over the button
        Returns:
        overButton true if over the button
